page.title: 01High Suffolk's large parish
page.content: Fressingfield lies two miles to the south of he boundary with Norfolk - river Waveney - equi distant from the county towns of Suffolk and Norfolk. Its centre core of church, chapels, school shops and wide range of services provides a self sufficient attractive place to live and is generating development of medium sized housing estates:which in turn, will ensure the viability of the facilities. Agriculture almost entirely productive arable-dominates but employs few. Employment is provided locally in the construction industry. Others are employed in manufacturing and service industries in Harleston. Diss and further afield. The area is pleasing visually in that its centre nestles in a valley bottom. its principle buildings are parish church and the best
